body.p: An attribute domain module defines exactly one global attribute specialized from either base or props. Attribute domains are normally used to define new applicability attributes (specializations of props).
body.note: If your markup requirement is to add an attribute to a specific element type, that is not allowed in DITA for the simple reason that any attribute-based syntax for describing the specialization hierarchy of individual attributes would just be insane. In DITA, you can achieve the effect of element-specific attributes by using data or, more likely, specializations of data. Or you can declare the attribute as global and simply document where it is intended to be used.
